title: When is riven getting balanced?
body: Has been stupidly op for quite a while now, when is this going to be fixed? From now on I refuse to play against riven until she's balanced.

I never said it's not for delivering the final blow, I did say it's not an execution though.
Executions are far more powerful than Riven's ult and more often than not they scale off of a missing health percentage of the target.
As in they gain bonus damage outside of their internal resource scaling. While Riven's ult is based only on her AD.

Most ultimates that are used almost exclusively for delivering the final blow are executions.

You are going to need to explain yourself because I don't follow,
Rivens ults DOES do more damage based on a percentage of missing health 
"The damage is increased by 2.67% for every 1% of an enemy's missing health"
Which is 1.67% MORE than Quinn's ult which is certainly an execution (skystrike, not Valor)
That brings Quinn's ults damage to 750 
And Riven's to 1056
So if you say Riven's isn't an execution then this is contrary to what you say about executions being more powerful
Also Garens ult with 75% missing hp on someone with 2500 hp (which is between squishy and tanks) does 
1275 damage which is less than half of Riven's AA more than the damage of her ult

Riven's ult does scale only off her AD like you say, so does Quinn's but It DOES gain bonus damage outside of its internal scaling.... Like Quinn's 
So I don't really understand what you mean.

An execution is where you directly scale off the enemy's missing health such as Elise's Q in spooder form.

>Lunges at a target enemy with a poisonous bite, dealing magic damage equal to a base amount plus 8% (+ 3% per 100 >AP) of target's missing health. Damage is capped against monsters.

Riven's ult is locked within her internal stats, not actually gaining damage from the missing health of an enemy it's used on.
Why are you not able to get this?

You seem to think that an execution can only be an ability that scales directly off missing health, that is not true
For example fizz's W's passive scales off missing HP but it is by no means an execute. Cho'gath's ult does not scale off missing HP but it is an execute

An move is generally considered an execute when it is at its most useful when it kills the target, for example:
Jinx's R scales off missing HP so it is at its most useful at the end of a fight when someone is low HP so it will do the max possible damage and kill them.
Another example is: 
Darius's ult, it doesn't scale off the targets missing HP but it is at its most useful at the end of a fight when he is more likely to have max stacks of his passive and if he does kill the target he gets to use his ult again thus being at its most useful by killing an enemy.
Another example is:
Caitlin's ult, this move just does straight damage, however it is at its most useful after a fight to pick off a fleeing enemy, it is virtually useless during a fight because a Caitlin should do more damage with her AA's during the channel time of her ult than the ult itself does. Plus the ult can be interrupted by cc on her.

examples of non execute ults are:
Vayne's ult, it is meant to be used at the start of a fight because that is when it is at its most useful so it's a duelling ult not an execute ult.

Azirs ult can be used at any time during the fight and the cc component is more valued than the damage mostly, even though it can be used to deliver the final blow it is not at its most effective when you do that.
